channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Stormy Daniels testifies in Trump's hush money trial
item.description: Former President Donald Trump's hush money trial continues in New York. Follow here for the latest live news updates, analysis and more.

item.title: TikTok sues federal government over potential US ban
item.description: TikTok and its owners ByteDance filed a lawsuit against the federal government Tuesday over its potential ban of the app in the United States.

item.title: Israeli military captures Palestinian side of Rafah crossing
item.description: Israel's military said it has taken control of the Palestinian side of the Rafah crossing, a vital entry point for aid to Gaza on the Egyptian border. Follow for live updates.

item.title: Trump trial: Stormy Daniels recounts alleged sexual encounter with Trump
item.description: Follow the latest developments in former President Donald Trump's criminal hush money trial in New York.

item.title: Deadly tornado reported in Oklahoma after barrage of destructive storms
item.description: Destructive storms and tornadoes hit the Central US on Monday and Tuesday, including at least one deadly tornado.

item.title: Tornadoes leave trail of destruction across 7 states
item.description: The most destructive storm appeared to have been in Barnsdall, Oklahoma, north of Tulsa, where major damage was reported.

item.title: May 6, 2024 Israel-Hamas war
item.description: Israeli airstrikes killed multiple people in Rafah early Tuesday, Palestinian officials said.

item.title: New York governor regrets saying Black kids in the Bronx don't know what a computer is
item.description: New York Gov. Kathy Hochul says she regrets making an offhand remark that suggested Black children in the Bronx do not know what the word “computer” means

item.title: The Met Gala 2024
item.description: The Met Gala, an annual, invitation-only event, was held Monday night in New York City.

item.title: Atlanta to pay $3.8 million to family of church deacon who died in struggle with officer
item.description: The Atlanta City Council has agreed to pay $3.8 million to settle a lawsuit by the family of a church deacon who died in a struggle with a city police officer following a minor car crash
